meanings.definition: To cry louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outbawl her brother when they both wanted the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The baby would outbawl all the other children in the daycare when she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor pretended to outbawl the others, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her sobs seemed to outbawl the storm raging outside, filling the room with her sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her outbawling echoed through the empty hallway, a heartbreaking melody of despair.

meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He would always outbawl his friends when they played games, trying to be the loudest.
meanings.sent2: The coach had to remind the players not to outbawl each other during the game.
meanings.sent3: At the concert, the singer tried to outbawl the crowd, but they cheered even louder.
meanings.sent4: His voice could outbawl a megaphone, making everyone turn their heads in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The protesters continued to outbawl the speaker, demanding to be heard over the noise.
